snippet: Chinese tunes on an 1877 music box at the Morris Museum in New Jersey, possibly heard by Puccini, may have inspired passages in his opera “Madama Butterfly.”
abstract: Chinese tunes from a 1977 harmoniphone music box on display at the Morris Museum in New Jersey may have inspired passages in Puccini's Madama Butterfly opera; W Anthony Sheppard makes connection on an unrelated trip to museum.
lead_paragraph: Chinese tunes on an 1877 music box at the Morris Museum in New Jersey, possibly heard by Puccini, may have inspired passages in his opera “Madama Butterfly.”

headline.seo: Puccini Opera Echoes a Music Box at the Morris Museum
headline.main: Music Box as Muse to Puccini’s ‘Butterfly’
headline.print_headline: Music Box As Muse To Puccini’s ‘Butterfly’
